meanings.definition: A plural noun meaning a type of insect larva.
meanings.sent1: The garden was full of tiny maggs crawling on the leaves.
meanings.sent2: The maggs transformed into beautiful butterflies.
meanings.sent3: The maggs had a race to see who could reach the flower first.
meanings.sent4: The maggs wriggled like tiny dancers on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The maggs squirmed in the sunlight, casting tiny shadows.

meanings.definition: A verb meaning to gather or collect in a disorderly manner.
meanings.sent1: She maggs all her toys into a messy pile in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The wind maggs up the fallen leaves into a swirling dance.
meanings.sent3: He tried to maggs all the scattered papers on his desk in a hurry.
meanings.sent4: The children maggs around the teacher, eager to hear the story.
meanings.sent5: The storm maggs the clouds together, creating a dark sky.
